intro: Xanthocephalum sericocarpum, commonly known as the silky false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and hairy leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in a head, followed by silky, hairy fruits that aid in wind dispersal. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. Xanthocephalum sericocarpum is a perennial herb that plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects.
